editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A19248 of text S108631 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 5663). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: More vvorke for a Masse-priest
titleStmt.author: Cooke, Alexander, 1564-1632.
Cooke, Alexander, 1564-1632. Worke for a Masse-priest.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Iones, dwelling in Red-crosse streete,

notesStmt.note: A much-expanded version of: Worke for a Masse-priest.
These two editions have "& smite" in line 7 of the title page.

Quires C-K exist in two settings: C1r: last line has (1) "æquivocation" or (2) "equivocation". D2r: signature mark is under (1) "vtrumque" or (2) "sed". E2r: line 1 ends with (1) question mark or (2) full stop. F3r: signature mark "F" under (1) "you" or (2) "say". G1r: line 6 has (1) "Ladie" or (2) "Lady". H1r: line 2, "Marie" in (1) roman or (2) italic. I1v: line 1 ends (1) "body" or (2) "bodie". K1r: line 2 begins (1) "withal" or (2) "withall". Additionally, quires A and L show two settings of the side-notes.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

keywords.term: Catholic Church -- Controversial literature -- Early works to 1800.
